doc.name: Wire
doc.description: A Wire is a stateful actor in DE. It should have an equal number of input and output channels. If it receives input on any of its channels, it will produce the most recent received on each input channel to the corresponding output channel for all channels. We can think its behavior similar to a wire in VHDL, where the value is always the most recently received. If no input has been received on an input channel, then the corresponding output channel will get the value given by initialValue, possibly converted to the type of the output. The type of the output is at least that of the input and that of initialValue. Hence, for example, if the input is a double and initialValue is an int, then the output will be a double.
doc.author: Adam Cataldo, Edward A. Lee (contributor)
doc.property: The value that is output when no input has yet been received on the corresponding channel. The output type at least the type of this parameter and the type of the input. The default value is 0 (an int).
